sentences.english: Both owners and pets in the dog-walking group had lost weight.
sentences.chinese: 遛狗那組的主人和寵物們都瘦了一些。

sentences.english: While walking the dog, you were careless and it got loose.
sentences.chinese: 在遛狗的時候，你一粗心鬆開了手中的狗鏈。

sentences.english: I caught Mr. Gesell at last, when he was airing the dog.
sentences.chinese: 我終於在格塞爾先生遛狗的時候攔住了他。

sentences.english: There are two, walking a basset down Beadel Street.
sentences.chinese: 兩個女孩，在彼得爾大街上悠閒的遛狗。

sentences.english: The only work he's been able to find, however, has been cat-sitting, dog-walking and elder care.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他能找到的工作只有看貓遛狗和照顧老人。

sentences.english: Just then, a woman, who was out walking her dog, shook the tramp's shoulder until he woke up again.
sentences.chinese: 就在那時，一個遛狗的女士走過來搖醒了流浪漢。

sentences.english: A woman, even if she's walking the dog or doing the dishes, is allowed to wear leg warmers.
sentences.chinese: 即使是遛狗或者刷盤子，女人也可以穿護腿。

sentences.english: Francie is used to seeing the old man walking his dog.
sentences.chinese: 法蘭欣習慣看到那個老先生遛狗。

sentences.english: I was walking the dog when my friend came.
sentences.chinese: 當我朋友來的時侯，我正在遛狗。

sentences.english: While the dog, you were careless and it got loose and was hit by a car.
sentences.chinese: 遛狗的時候，你太大意了，狗一鬆被車撞了。

sentences.english: I know many people who have made good friends at the dog-walkers park.
sentences.chinese: 我知道有許多人在公園遛狗時成爲了好朋友。

sentences.english: Bob will walk the dog with bill and then play chess.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃和比爾先遛狗，然後再下象棋。

definition: to take a dog for a walk
(dialect) to take a walk/to go for a stroll
to take a walk/to go for a walk
erhua variant of 遛彎|遛弯[liu4 wan1]
to stroll/to go for a walk
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to play (as children do)/to amuse oneself
variant of 軋馬路|轧马路[ya4 ma3 lu4]
to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street
